author.bio: I build custom themes and plugins for NC State University's Office of Information Technology, and I help maintain campus WordPress environments and advise clients on content best practices. I'm always excited to talk about universal design, accessibility, usability, and designing with compassion and empathy. I host the WPCampus Podcast, where I get to talk about all those things and more!

node.content:
On many campuses, WordPress isn’t the only CMS in use. And if we start thinking about learning management systems, campus portals, and the many other ways our schools use the web, WordPress is clearly just one part of a complex web landscape.

This episode features WPCampus community members Brian DeConinck and Eric Sembrat. Eric is a developer and web manager with Georgia Tech’s College of Engineering. He recently spoke at HighEdWeb on the topic: “Unbundle Your Institution: Building a Web CMS Ecosystem.”

  • View Eric’s slides from HighEdWeb 2017
  • Find Eric online: webbeh.com

As mentioned in the episode, the WPCampus Online Call for Speakers ends on November 10, 2017.

NOTE: Between when this episode was recorded and published, the deadline for applying to host WPCampus 2018 was extended! Submit your application by Friday, November 3!
